New York University Abu Dhabi Library
Bilder-Atlas zu Mekka and ephemera - Hisham Khatib Collection
Khatib, Hisham, Mr.
Snouck Hurgronje, C. (Christiaan)
Snouck Hurgronje, C. (Christiaan)
Haag, M. Nijhoff (1888-1889)
ʻabd Al-Ghaffār, Al-Sayyid
Muḥammad Ṣādiq, Bey,
AD.MC.030_ref184
37 Leaves
Circa 1884-1888 1888 Generally good, some brittle and warped. A partial Bilder-Atlas zu Mekka von Dr. C. Snouck Hurgronje. Herausgegeben von Het Koninklijk Instituut voor Taal-, Land- en Volkenkunde van Nederlandsch-Indië te 's-Gravenhage (Picture Atlas of Mekka by Dr. Christiaan Snouck Hurgronje. Published by the Royal Institute for Linguistics, Land and Ethnology of the Dutch East Indies in The Hague). Imprint Haag: Martinus Nijhoff, 1888. The folio includes photographic and lithographic prints by Muḥammad Ṣādiq Bey (1822 or 1823–1902 or 1903), an Egyptian army engineer who took the first photographs of Medina in 1861 and Mecca in 1880-81 and by al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Ghaffār (recognised as the first Meccan photographer). Digitized alongside the Bilder-Atlas was the accompanying ephemera including an article entitled How the Mecca pilgrimage is Conducted by A. E. Wort in The Wide World Magazine (1900) and from the March 1937 edition of Life Magazine, The Camera Overseas: Egypt Sends a Carpet to Mecca. Digital copy only: 030_ref184
Content Description
Bilder-Atlas zu Mekka and ephemera
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Dr. Hisham Khatib are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact Akkasah at akkasah@nyu.edu
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.

Festung auf dem Djèbèl Hindî; 3. Gebäude des Zemzembrunnens; 7. Mimbar (Kanzel); 8. Maqâm èl-Hanafî; 9. Maqâm èl-Mâlikî; 10. Maqâm èl-Hambalî. Die Treppen zur Ka'bah und der Maqâm Ibrâhîm (zugleich Maqâm ès-Schâfi'î) sind hier durch das Zemzemgebäude dem Auge entzogen. The mosque and the northwestern part of the city. The Office of the Qâdhî; 2. Fortress on the Djèbèl Hindî 3. Building of the Zemzem Fountain; 7. Mimbar (pulpit); 8. Maqâm èl-Hanafî; 9. Maqâm èl-Mâlikî; 10. Maqâm èl-Hambalî.
